{"step_by_step_thinking": "The occlusal clearance of an onlay refers to the space between the onlay and the opposing tooth when the mouth is closed. Depth cuts are used to determine the depth of the preparation, not the occlusal clearance. Visual inspection is not accurate enough to determine occlusal clearance. Wax chew-in is used to record occlusal relationships, not to detect occlusal clearance. Articulating paper is used to mark the contact points between the upper and lower teeth, which can help detect the occlusal clearance.", "answer_choice": "D. Articulating paper"}
